Provisions of 38 CFR 3.50 as it Applies to a Surviving Spouse
Under
38 CFR 3.50
, in order to qualify as a surviving spouse for Department of Veterans Affairs (VA) purposes, a person
must
be unmarried.  Therefore, a surviving spouse who remarries is no longer eligible to receive VA benefits.
Effective January 2, 2025,
Public Law (PL) 118-210
removed the previous inference of marriage restriction which stated that the claimant may not be living with another person and holding themselves out publicly as the spouse of that person.  As such, payment of survivor’s benefits is only barred when due to remarriage, as applicable.
Exceptions
:
If a surviving spouse remarries upon attaining age 55, they may retain eligibility for certain VA benefits under
PL 107-330
, and
PL 116-315
.
If a surviving spouse remarries upon attaining age 57, they may retain eligibility for certain VA benefits under
PL 108-183
, and
PL 116-315
.
